lines.text: A winning football team, gentlemen, that's the answer to our problems.

I'm against having this man Gore here at Calvert on any basis. He's a headline hunter, an unscrupulous high-pressure showman! I don't want to see our students turned into tramp athletes, stage-struck performers in a Saturday circus. Why, he's professionalized every college that's employed him. Surely, we can pay for our laboratory without resorting to the things that he stands for.
You read about Napoleon?
Hey, you know I don't read much.
You know, that guy'd a made a great little football coach.
Yeah, I bet he would, at that.
Sure, and I wouldn't make a bad general.
There, there ain't much dough in that, though, is there?
Say, the next time there's a war, I'm gonna show 'em how a battle should be staged. It's just like football, Napoleon knew that.
Yeah, but he lost out in his big game, didn't he.
No, he got crossed up in his signals.
Oh say, did you make deals with Weaver, Holcomb and Matthews?
Yeah, I got 'em cheap too, considering how scarce good backfield material is. I had 'em at summer school all summer so they'd be legible.
Oh, that's fine. Oh, why you're at it, pick me up a couple of good tackles that can understand English, will ya.

[Opens train car window]
Don't mention it. Anything you like. Open or shut.
You know what I want shut and it isn't the window.
Well, this is where I get off, baby. Come and see me play football sometime.
Hello, darling.
[Embrace and kiss]
Gee, baby, its swell to see ya.
It seems like months instead of weeks.
Did you miss me, honey?
Of course, I did.
Like it? Jump in.
Shall I drive?
Well, you might as well get used to it. It's yours from now on.
Sweet boy.
[Kiss]
Boy, how'd you like to stick your finger in her coffee?
Can I give you a lift? We'll make better time.
Who will? You or I?
Why don't you get in and find out.
No, I guess I'll walk. So long.
That's your induction badge for the Campfire Boys of America. They are making you an honorary Grand Woodcraft Chief. I fixed it up for you.
I see. What are you getting out of it this time?
Oh, they're just making me an honorary Woodpecker. He's a Pecker too.
Yeah, well listen Woodpeckers you can take your Campfire Boys and...
Now, wait a minute coach, you better do it, it's swell publicity. Remember, over a million kids belong to the Campfire Boys. They all got families and they all go to football games.
Pop Warner didn't get it.
He didn't?
No. Every Campfire Boy in America will have to call you Chief. You know, some of the biggest men in the world got it. As, eh, Will Rogers, Edward G. Robinson, W. C. Fields, Mickey Mouse.
Where did they ever coach?
All I need to win another conference championship is eleven apple-cheeked lads and a football.
I wonder who the dame is he's with? Must be awful lonesome to go out with that egg.

And all of you remember this, all of you, there's a crazy, daffy crowd out there screaming for a hundred thousand dollars worth a ball game. Now, go on out and deliver. That's all! Same team that ran through signals last night, starts the game today. Go on out and fight! All of you!
Why not come with me?
Is that a proposition?
I'm not kidding. We could get married.
I've got one husband. That's supposed to be my quota.
Did you ever hear of a place called Mexico? You could divorce that palooka in a week.
I told you to lay off that palooka stuff and I mean it!

Four Aces! The greatest backfield ever assembled, together again for the first time this season. I guess Gore slipped one over this time and does it change the picture. What a ball game! Anything can happen now!
Listen, I wouldn't play for Gore if he come here in person crawling on his knees to me. And that's from me with love and kisses.
Can you imagine that stooge asking me to play? That's rich!
Say, listen, I'm the best back in the conference. In the country maybe. Why, I could go out there today and smear them monkeys like an army tank!
